page.title: 14Horningsham Parish Council
page.content: The Parish Council consists of eleven elected members,each lasting for four years.A Chairman is elected each year .Mr John Crossman being the present Chairman. The Council meets at the Village Hall four times a year with extra meetings if necessary. One of these meetings is the Annual Parish Meeting, when any parishioners can come and discuss business. Planning applications in the Village are discussed by the Council whose recommendations are passed to the District Council. The Parish Council makes annual donations to the Church, Chapel and Village Hall towards their upkeep. The Council is also responsible for administering 'Taylors Charity', a sum of money left to the poor of the Village by a man called Taylor.
